H0.text: Deer receive their energy directly from the Sun, as every organism in an ecosystem obtains energy from another source.

H1.text: Fungus receives its energy directly from the Sun, while every organism in an ecosystem obtains energy from another source.

H2.text: Grass receives its energy directly from the Sun, as it is an organism in an ecosystem that obtains energy from another source.

H3.text: The hawk receives its energy directly from the Sun, as every organism in an ecosystem obtains energy from another source.

A6.text: Energy and carbon enter ecosystems through photosynthesis, are incorporated into living tissue, transferred to other organisms that feed on the living and dead plant matter

A7.text: Photosynthetic organisms are the primary producers

A8.text: Plants convert about 1% of the sunlight they receive into chemical energy

A9.text: Decomposers recycle nutrients, leaving them so they can be reused by primary producers
